title: What Flyboard does
content: Flyboard builds production-ready AI voice agents that automate high-volume, repeatable sales and operations workflows. Typical use cases include inbound qualification, outbound follow-ups, appointment scheduling, payment reminders, and post-call summarization.

title: Supported languages
content: Flyboard agents support Spanish and English by default. Portuguese is available on request depending on the voice provider and evaluation. Additional languages require a scoping call.

title: Integrations overview
content: Common integrations include HubSpot, Salesforce, Google Calendar, and custom CRMs via REST. For messaging we can trigger email/SMS/WhatsApp via customer-approved providers.

title: CRM writeback
content: CRM writeback means the agent can create or update records (lead/contact/deal) after a call. Writeback requires: field mapping, a dedicated API token, and approval of the data model. Typical setup time is 2–5 business days.

title: Calendar booking behavior
content: Appointment scheduling uses a customer-provided calendar integration. The agent checks availability rules (working hours, buffers, meeting length) and books the earliest slot that matches the customer’s constraints.

title: Pricing model (high level)
content: Pricing is composed of a platform fee plus usage-based voice minutes. Enterprise features (advanced analytics, custom SLAs, dedicated routing) may add a fixed monthly amount. Exact quotes depend on volume and complexity.

title: What is included in onboarding
content: Standard onboarding includes: workflow definition, call script + guardrails, integration setup (if needed), test calls, and go-live monitoring. Typical onboarding is 1–3 weeks depending on integrations.

title: SLA and uptime (standard)
content: Standard SLA targets 99.5% monthly uptime for the core platform. Incident communication is provided during business hours, with escalation paths for critical issues. Custom SLAs available for enterprise.

title: Latency expectations
content: End-to-end perceived latency depends on telephony provider and model selection. For most production setups, we aim for fast turn-taking and stable conversations. Low latency configurations may trade off some reasoning depth.

title: Data retention policy (default)
content: By default, call metadata and agent outputs are retained for 90 days. Retention can be shortened or extended by agreement. Sensitive fields can be redacted before storage depending on customer requirements.

title: PII handling
content: We follow least-privilege access and minimize PII. For workflows involving personal data, we recommend explicit redaction rules and a documented data map. Customers remain data controllers for their datasets.

title: Outbound calling prerequisites
content: Outbound campaigns require: approved calling lists, calling windows, opt-out handling, and compliant local calling practices. The customer is responsible for ensuring lawful basis and consent where required.

title: Opt-out behavior
content: If a user requests not to be contacted, the agent must confirm opt-out and tag the record as do-not-contact. Downstream systems should respect the do-not-contact tag.

title: Troubleshooting: audio quality complaints
content: First checks: provider incident status, jitter/packet loss, regional routing, and voice model stability. Collect: call_id, timestamp, region, provider, and a short user description. Escalate if repeated across regions.

title: Troubleshooting: failed CRM writeback
content: Common causes: expired tokens, field mapping drift, permission changes, rate limits. Collect: customer_id, integration type, error logs, and a sample payload. Create a ticket with high priority if blocking go-live.

title: Escalation policy
content: Escalate immediately if: widespread call failures, booking failures, CRM writeback failures for multiple customers, or any suspected data leak. Use priority 'high' tickets for incidents affecting production.

title: How to request a custom SLA
content: Custom SLAs are available for enterprise plans. Requirements typically include dedicated monitoring, agreed response times, and defined severity levels. A scoping call is required.

title: Supported CRMs
content: Common supported CRMs: HubSpot and Salesforce. Custom CRMs can be supported via REST APIs or middleware, depending on authentication and data model.
